clinical_study.brief_title: Edaravone Dexborneol for Treatment of Hypertensive Intracerebral Hemorrhage
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Edaravone Dexborneol in Addition to Standard of Care in Patients With Hypertensive Intracerebral Hemorrhage: a Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The proportionof Participants With modified Rankin Scale (mRS) 0 ~ 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: 90 days after the first dose of study treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 90 days after the first dose of study treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportionof Participants With modified Rankin Scale (mRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 14, 30 and 90 days after the first dose of study treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: The change in the NIH stroke scale (NIHSS) from the baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 14, 30 and 90 days after the first dose of study treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportionof Participants With Glasgow Outcome Score (GOS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 14, 30 and 90 days after the first dose of study treatment
90 days after the first dose of study treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Stroke Specific Quality of Life Scale (SS-QOL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 90 days after the first dose of study treatment

intervention.description: Edaravone Dexborneol 37.5 mg, containing Edaravone 30 mg and Dexborneol 7.5 mg, Edaravone Dexborneol 37.5 mg BID, 14 days, addition to standard of care of Intracerebral Hemorrhage
Edaravone Dexborneol matching injection, addition to standard of care of Intracerebral Hemorrhage

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent from the patient or legally acceptable representative
- Males and females
- Diagnose as hypertensive intracerebral hemorrhage
- Onset of symptoms within 6~48 hours
- Position of bleeding major in basal ganglia
- The sum of scores on items 5 and 6 on the NIHSS were >= 2 at baseline and the total score (items 1-11) was >=6 and <=20
- Volume of Hematoma <= 30 ml
- Premorbid mRS score of 0 or 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergy to known study drugs or excipients
- Experienced stroke in latest 3 month
- Volume of Hematoma > 5 ml in other bleeding position
- Obstructive hydrocephalus
- Any diagnosis as other than hypertensive ICH
- Unconsciousness
- Severe concurrent illness with life expectancy less than 90 days
- Pregnancy or breast-feeding

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University
